definition[0]: burning strongly with a lot of flames
example[0]: Within minutes the whole house was ablaze.
example[1]: The factory had been set ablaze  (=made to burn).
explanation[0]: Ablaze is mostly used in journalism or in literature. In everyday English, people usually say on fire:
example[2]: The whole house was on fire.
example[3]: a passing pleasure-boat, with all its lights ablaze
example[4]: Her yard was ablaze with summer flowers.
definition[2]: feeling or showing strong emotion, especially anger
example[5]: His eyes were ablaze with fury.
